snippet.textDisplay: Heck yeah!! The game that inspired many a lost soul of the early 2000's and thus constructed an army of RPG and paper-loving fans who would forever clamor for all the great characters of times pass that sadly would never again gain more screen time...like...Bobbery or Vivian! Hooktail! Rawk Hawk! GOD I loved this game! It's an absolute classic. If Nintendo does announce a new one, I won't care, because you can't beat this one.

snippet.textDisplay: Paper Mario: The Thousand Year Door is my all-time favorite game!! No need to say I HOPE Nintendo announces a new Paper Mario this E3. But please, if they do, let it be a traditional RPG like the first two PM games, with new characters, new environments, the return of the stage-play battles, etc...
snippet.textOriginal: Paper Mario: The Thousand Year Door is my all-time favorite game!! No need to say I HOPE Nintendo announces a new Paper Mario this E3. But please, if they do, let it be a traditional RPG like the first two PM games, with new characters, new environments, the return of the stage-play battles, etc...

snippet.textDisplay: This song has always been really catchy and relaxing.  I'm hoping the next Paper Mario is more like the first two.  Super Paper Mario had an awesome story and characters, but I didn't care much for the combat, and the only thing I liked from Sticker Star was the music and a few areas like the mansion.

snippet.textDisplay: I get the feeling we will definitely see a new Paper Mario soon. Maybe not this year, but soon. The two Mario RPG franchises seem to release one after the other. First Paper Mario, then Superstar Saga. Then Thousand-Year Door and then Partners in Time. Then Super Paper Mario and then Bowser's Inside Story. Then Sticker Star and then Dream Team. So, in keeping with this pattern, a new Paper Mario must be on its way.
snippet.textOriginal: I get the feeling we will definitely see a new Paper Mario soon. Maybe not this year, but soon. The two Mario RPG franchises seem to release one after the other. First Paper Mario, then Superstar Saga. Then Thousand-Year Door and then Partners in Time. Then Super Paper Mario and then Bowser's Inside Story. Then Sticker Star and then Dream Team. So, in keeping with this pattern, a new Paper Mario must be on its way.

snippet.textDisplay: Nintendo, just announce a new Paper Mario game this year and I'll be happy. Nothing too fancy, just a normal Paper Mario RPG with new paper mechanics, let's forget Sticker Star happened. TTYD is one of my favorite games ever, so I'd also be happy with a 3DS port so I can play it anywhere. I always loved this underground theme: ambient but backed by a nice beat... feels like you're in a mysterious digital world.
snippet.textOriginal: Nintendo, just announce a new Paper Mario game this year and I'll be happy. Nothing too fancy, just a normal Paper Mario RPG with new paper mechanics, let's forget Sticker Star happened. TTYD is one of my favorite games ever, so I'd also be happy with a 3DS port so I can play it anywhere. I always loved this underground theme: ambient but backed by a nice beat... feels like you're in a mysterious digital world.

snippet.textDisplay: @sety holsety You're right;  I'm looking at their list of games and there are plenty of good games.  I wonder what so wrong with Sticker Star...
snippet.textOriginal: @sety holsety You're right;  I'm looking at their list of games and there are plenty of good games.  I wonder what so wrong with Sticker Star...

snippet.textDisplay: @Zack Bond I really agree with you, as an avid fan of the traditional RPG formula I was shocked and disappointed as I learned more about SS, and came to understand that it has essentially none of the elements I liked about the first 2 Paper Mario games. No leveling, no partners, no badges. Who in their right mind makes a Paper Mario game without experience points, partners or badges? Even the plot was minimal... To this day I can't wrap my head around it at all, Intelligent Systems is usually so damn competent.
snippet.textOriginal: @Zack Bond I really agree with you, as an avid fan of the traditional RPG formula I was shocked and disappointed as I learned more about SS, and came to understand that it has essentially none of the elements I liked about the first 2 Paper Mario games. No leveling, no partners, no badges. Who in their right mind makes a Paper Mario game without experience points, partners or badges? Even the plot was minimal... To this day I can't wrap my head around it at all, Intelligent Systems is usually so damn competent.

snippet.textDisplay:
@sety holsety Sticker Star was such a bad game.  Simply put, Paper Mario is not about being Paper... It's about Mario&Luigi-like controls and being a Mario RPG game with partners.

Interesting... It looks like Paper Mario is the partner now.
snippet.textOriginal:
@sety holsety Sticker Star was such a bad game.  Simply put, Paper Mario is not about being Paper... It's about Mario&Luigi-like controls and being a Mario RPG game with partners.

Interesting... It looks like Paper Mario is the partner now.

snippet.textDisplay:
@ShinParisu You must not have played Paper Mario: Sticker Star yet because they threw all the Paper Mario formulas out the window and just "stuck" Paper Mario on the cover to sell copies.


Fighting doesn't give you exp, exploration is boring, no badges or partners... at least Super Paper Mario still did most things right and was an enjoyable game to play.
